Job Title: Senior Analyst, Sales Strategy & Operations--Surgical Structural Heart
Job Description:
Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. For more than 50 years, we have established a remarkable track record around that innovation: Work that enables clinicians around the world to enhance and save lives. We are experiencing massive growth, and this is your opportunity to make a big impact!

As the Sr. Analyst, Sales Strategy and Ops, you’ll help shape the future of our sales organization and be a key contributor to the success of the team. You’ll help design compensation and awards programs, fine-tune sales territories to drive efficiency, all while motivating the team to reach even greater heights.

Key Responsibilities:
Continuously monitor the effectiveness of sales programs, gather feedback from sales leaders, and identify opportunities to drive added sales field focus and motivation.
Proactively communicate opportunities for increased operational efficiency by analyzing territory performance, including: KPIs, span of control, and account to territory alignments.
Support sales compensation modelling & quota allocation strategy. Administer monthly sales incentive compensation & sales awards process in alignment with approved plans, ensuring both accuracy and completeness.
Partner with IT and the sales team to train, gather feedback, and lead initiatives to add new features to enhance the functionality of our suite of sales compensation solutions.
Collaborate with cross functional partners (Sales Leadership, Marketing, Inventory, Strategy, etc) to understand their needs, and to develop tailored solutions that address key business challenges and opportunities.
Distill large datasets into concise stories through various medium (ad-hoc reports, data models, dashboards) to drive sales insight and enable action.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in related field of study, 5 years of previous analytical experience including, spreadsheets, database management systems, and word processing.

Preferred Qualifications:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to translate complex data into meaningful narratives that guide decision-making.
Advanced Excel skills, including data analysis and modeling.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to convey insights effectively through ad-hoc reports, presentations, and data models.
Project management skills to ensure projects are fully scoped and delivered in a timely manner.
Experience with compensation modeling tools (Anaplan, Xactly, QuotaPath etc.).
Experience with sales territory mapping software, such as Javelin, Geopointe, or similar.
Experience managing cross functional partnerships, communicating needs, and maintaining close coordination (IT, Sales Leaders).

Aligning our overall business objectives with performance, we offer competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and a wide variety of benefits programs to address the diverse individual needs of our employees and their families.

For California, the base pay range for this position is $86,000 to $121,000 (highly experienced).

The pay for the successful candidate will depend on various factors (e.g., qualifications, education, prior experience).

About Edwards Lifesciences

Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease and critical care monitoring. We are inspired to help patients. We collaborate with the world’s leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Join our team of over 19,000 dedicated, unique individuals and discover how you can make a difference.

COVID Vaccination Requirement

Edwards is committed to complying with the requirements and guidance from our government authorities and to protecting our vulnerable patients and the healthcare providers who are treating them around the world. As such, all Healthcare Interacting positions require COVID-19 vaccination, which includes anyone who directly interfaces with patients and those who interact with healthcare providers as part of their role. This vaccination requirement does not apply in countries where it is prohibited by law to impose vaccination. In countries where vaccines are less available, or other requirements exist, we may institute alternate measures that optimize patient safety and healthcare provider safety, which may include regular COVID testing or specific masking requirements.

Job Title: Sr. Financial Analyst (Disneyland Resort Park Operations Finance)
Job Description:
About the Role & Team:

Would you enjoy collaborating closely with operators to create lifelong memories for Guests of Disney Parks, Experiences and Products? Do you love to learn about business models which include live entertainment, thrill rides, food & beverage, and retail operations? Are you naturally curious about understanding the “why” behind business performance?

As a Sr. Financial Analyst on the Disneyland Resort Park Operations Finance team, you would get to analyze metrics and trends to understand and influence business results. You would provide key input on new business models and initiatives, designed to directly improve Guest experiences and drive shareholder value. You would work closely with operations leaders and partners to make a difference.

In this specific role, we are looking for an individual with a dual passion for business results and database management skills. The Sr. Analyst will split their time supporting an operations finance area and being point at developing an internal database solution enabling dynamic reporting and data visualization for the operations finance team.

What You Will Do:

Business Goal Achievement – Evaluate key business drivers to measure the success of Disneyland Resort Park Operations. Support financial planning processes across key business cycles, including Annual Operating Plan, Quarterly Forecasts, and Monthly/Quarterly financial reviews inclusive of cost trending analysis and operating income cause of change analysis

Database Management – Create a database (in snowflake or the like) to house operations finance data pulling from multiple sources of information and organizing in a structure that the entire operation finance team can tap into, update, and create data visualization

Partner Collaboration – Develop and maintain relationships with partners in Disneyland Park or Disney California Adventure to frequently review financial results, analyze and consult on business decisions, make changes to the operation, drive new initiatives, and identify financial impacts of strategic opportunities

Communication - Organize strong written and verbal communication that conveys data and analysis to partners at all levels, including General Managers and Vice Presidents. ability to shift between technical and non-technical terminology depending on audience.

Data Visualization – Leverage data visualization techniques, tools, and communication skills to present complex analytical findings in clear business terms that facilitate acceptance, decision-making, and execution by business partners

Innovation - Drive efficiency through process improvements, including maintaining and creating financial models, templates, and planning processes

Required Qualifications & Skills:

3-5 years of experiences with statistical, financial, or strategic analysis

Knowledge of forecasting and financial modeling, including proficiency in acquiring, organizing, and analyzing large amounts of data

Database management knowledge and skills including SQL or Python

Utilize multiple systems and tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, SAP, Longview, and Tableau, to understand, review, and summarize operating performance

The ability to explain complex analytics in a way that is easily understandable and executable, and enjoy “storytelling” to engage and influence your audience

Strong attention to detail and data accuracy, and the ability to think holistically

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Natural curiosity and inquisitiveness, and enjoy solving problems

The ability to work in a team environment, in person and virtually, with a positive demeanor

Ability to meet deadlines, handle multiple priorities, and perform job responsibilities accurately with minimal supervision

Utilize multiple systems and tools, including Excel, PowerPoint, SAP, Longview, SQL, and Tableau, to understand, review, and summarize operating performance

Advanced skills in Excel, including basic knowledge of Power Query and VBA, and PowerPoint

Experience with basic data visualization using tools such as Tableau or Power BI

The capability to meet deadlines, handle multiple priorities, and perform job responsibilities accurately with minimal supervision

Education:

You have a Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Analytics, Business, Finance, Industrial Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent substitute.

Additional Information:

Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities, and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits

At The Walt Disney Company, everyone belongs! We want our employees to be themselves as this diversity promotes creativity, innovation, and overall helps us better serve our Disney guests and employees. Our commitment to a diverse and inclusive culture is unwavering, and we take great pride in the culture we’ve created. We invite you to belong! Apply today!!

About Hyundai GLOVIS America Inc.

GLOVIS America, Inc. is a third-party logistics provider headquartered in Irvine, CA. Since our inception in 2002, we are committed to delivering our customers products via truck, rail, or ocean vessel throughout the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. Glovis America makes every effort to exceed standards by providing quality service to our customers and vendors of the automotive, freight forwarding, parts distribution, used car, and fuel industries. We cater logistics strategies and processes to our customers' needs by utilizing the latest information systems and advanced technologies.

Summary

The Senior Analyst, Rail Operations will be responsible for supporting the GLOVIS Rail Transportation Network by creating specific reports and conducting in-depth analysis that will lead to better overall optimization. The Senior Analyst will work with rail vendors on a daily basis and ensure data transmissions are received in ITMS system promptly and correctly. Analyst will also ensure timely payment to our rail vendors by resolving audit holds. Furthermore, the position will regularly report to our customers with any reports and information when requested.

Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities
Process and audit invoices from rail vendors, both manual and EDI
Research, analyze, and resolve discrepancies with rail carriers resulting from audit holds
Review manual invoices and backup data for exactness and ensure proper documentation/approvals are provided
Troubleshoot invoicing and waybill/delivery file transmission issues for the vendors, identifying root cause errors
Work closely with our IT department to help resolve outstanding invoices from rail vendors
Work closely with our finance department to make sure vendors invoices are paid in a timely manner
Manage billing aging and ensure AP accounts with rail vendors are current
Work closely with billing department to help monitor and track missing waybill/shipping records on vehicles and communicate to vendors to submit
Review and analyze rail AR accounts and make sure GLOVIS is receiving payments accordingly
Secondary Responsibilities
Create railcar delay reports for customers daily
Monitor dwell time, ensuring vehicles are unloaded in a timely manner. Research delays and provide status updates on all aged vehicles
Communicate with the customers and rail vendors on any potential issues
Request shipment reports and ETAs from rail vendors to report to our customers
Calculate allocation of permits for embargo rail ramps and distribute them to various port locations
Assist with land bridge projects as well as upcoming projects
Manage rail pipeline report and work alongside VL rail ramp team members to provide unloading ETAs
Other Duties as Assigned
Support in special projects and other duties as assigned
Create ad-hoc reports

Compensation Range

$55,000- $65,000 Annually

Medical Insurance

Dental Insurance
Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Basic Life and AD&D as well as Short and Long Term Disability

Pet Insurance
Hospital and Critical Illness Insurance

401(k) with Generous Matching
Referral Bonuses*
Auto Allowance*
Quarterly Employee Lunches, Summer Refreshments, and Monthly Team Building Activities*
Discretionary Bonuses*
Tuition Reimbursement*
Benefits may vary by location. All benefits pursuant to Company policy

Skills

Must possess communication, planning, organizational, time management, and critical thinking skills Required
Interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with different departments along with current and future customers Required
Ability to logically and systematically work through problems Required
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point), web navigation, file management, and general PC system Required
Must be able to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems Required

Education & Experience

High School Diploma/G.E.D Required
2 years of experience in Billing, Logistics, Operations, Customer Service, or Transportation Required

Physical Requirements

Stand/walk

Typical office environment with low-level noise exposure

Golden Star Technology Inc. (GST) in Cerritos, California is actively seeking an experienced full-time NetSuite Business Analyst to join our team. Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Do you want to work for an industry-leading technology company that will value you? If yes, please continue reading!

The NetSuite Business Analyst earns a competitive wage. We provide great benefits and perks, including health, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan, vacation time, company perks, and community service days. If this sounds like the right career opportunity for you, apply today!

ABOUT GOLDEN STAR TECHNOLOGY INC. (GST)

Founded in 1985, we have grown by offering the widest breadth of products, custom-tailored solutions, and exceptional customer service across industry-leading and visionary technologies. We are a woman-owned minority business that helps clients stay ahead of the technology curve with a wealth of advanced IT and audiovisual (AV) solutions. Our company is highly versatile, offering a broad array of end-to-end technology solutions and services including managed services, worldwide logistics, systems integration, deployment and supply chain, and audiovisual. We have been awarded to the Top 100 Places to Work list by the Los Angeles Business Journal in 2020 and 2021 and awarded to the 2021 Best Workplaces list by Inc. Magazine in 2021.

DAY OF A NETSUITE BUSINESS ANALYST

The NetSuite Business Analyst engages and communicates with all company stakeholders (i.e. Accounting, Sales, Warehouse, etc). The individual is responsible for all aspects of GST's NetSuite ERP operations. In addition, the individual is putting together analysis of the NetSuite data to enable GST to make better business decisions and prioritize strategy priorities

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with internal stakeholders to analyze complex needs and issues and assess how NetSuite can be utilized as a solution to ongoing issues within business operations that can be addressed with an ERP system.
Perform day-to-day operation, maintenance, projects, change request and support tasks for the entire NetSuite application and ecosystem.
Plan, review, revise, develop, test and deploy feature configurations and customizations of NetSuite to meet evolving business and operational needs.
Workflow design, maintenance and troubleshoot.
Create new dashboards, saved searches, manage users, roles and permissions, KPIs/Metrics, custom reports and fields, and create custom workflows
Monitor end-user usage, daily system scripts and track performance.
Develop, document, and implement policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure data integrity, change protocols, customization, usage etc.

Job Qualifications

Bachelors Degree
3+ years with ERP systems.
3+ years with business data analytics.
Experience in distribution, warehouse, manufacturing industries a plus.
NetSuite certification a plus.
Java scripting, SQL, Advanced Excel skills a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.

Ability to work independently and demonstrate commitment to both quality and tight deadlines.

FLSA: Salaried Exempt

Department: Operations

Reports To: Manager of Operations

To apply, e-mail your resume to

careers@axonics.com

Job Scope and Quality Impact:

The MES Operations Analyst / Developer is responsible for the technical implementation of MES software as well as execution of installation, upgrades, testing, and system configuration during implementation projects. The role will partner with Quality and Operations to analyze and verify operational needs, and to understand business objectives and goals. The engineer should possess and maintain a high level of product and company specific business knowledge by remaining current with emerging product and technical updates.

General Description and Duties:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job task satisfactorily. The tasks listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Implementing all aspects required for successful MES deployment, including architecting, modeling and setup, testing, troubleshooting, training setup and delivery, and ongoing support and maintenance.
Creating documentation, including writing protocols and reports, and other documents such as trace matrices, test cases, and validation protocols and reports.
Identifying opportunities for improvements in existing MES processes, modeling, documentation, and training to optimize workflow and efficiency.
Planning and overseeing the deployment and layout of MES related workstations in manufacturing areas.
Interface with cross-functional teams and manufacturing personnel to ensure smooth implementation of changes.
Author work instruction and process documentation describing the setup and maintenance of MES processes.
Design and implement a data management strategy for integration of MES solutions with existing ERP and PLM databases.
Work cross-functionally with Operations, Quality, and various other support groups to determine design, modeling, and script requirements.
Monitor, track, and report operations performance to Operations Management team.

Projects and Other Duties:

Performs other duties as assigned.

Position Qualifications

Expert in MES software modeling and customizations, preferably with Siemens OpCenter and Designer.
Expert in SQL programming, preferably T-SQL, PLSQL, and dynamic SQL coding.
Expert Excel user, preferably with VBA and ODBC connections experience.
Experience with multiple reporting platforms, including but not limited to, SSRS, Power BI, Incorta, Spotfire, SAP Business Objects, Tableu, Kinaxis Rapid Response.
Experience in large cross-functional projects.

Minimum Education:

Minimum Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, a similar technical degree, or equivalent job experience

Minimum Experience:

2-3 years of experience in application configuration, deployment, and support of MES systems (Siemens OpsCenter preferred) in a manufacturing environment.
Understanding of system cGMP requirements and maintenance lifecycle in cGMP environments. Experience working in life science or similar regulated industry preferred.
Working experience with SQL, and support with implementing MES updates.

Salary:

Aligning our overall business objectives with performance and merit based pay, Axonics offers competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and Employer paid benefits programs to address the diverse individual needs of our employees and their families. At Axonics, our employees come first!
For California, the base pay range for this position is $90,000 to $130,000 (highly experienced).
The pay for the successful candidate will depend on various factors (e.g., qualifications, education, prior experience).
Axonics is an Equal Opportunity Employer, included protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Job Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - Oracle SCM
Job Description:
MAIN JOB RESPONSIBILITIES / COMPETENCIES
Reporting to the Sr. Manager - SCM, the incumbent will be crucial in optimizing STAAR SCM systems and processes using their expertise in Oracle Fusion SCM applications. Responsibilities will include collaborating with the supply chain teams (Procurement, Sales, and Manufacturing) to design, implement, and support technical solutions that align with business objectives.

Key Responsibilities
Business Requirement Analysis

Partners with business stakeholders to analyze, define and document business requirements, within and across functional areas
Drives best practices during requirements gathering and modeling
Has a strong focus on gathering core requirements, beyond stated requirements and correctly places these within a broader context
Understands business environment and helps to connect/align relevant business stakeholders
Process Modeling and Design

Partners with business stakeholders to analyze, define and document business processes within and across functional areas
Drives best practices during requirements gathering and modeling
Understands business environment and helps to connect/align relevant business stakeholders
Manages stakeholder expectations and communications within and beyond functional track
Solution Design

Responsible to design and document cross-functional and global solutions, drawing on functional expertise of functional and technical team members or vendors, as appropriate
Advises on solutions prepared by peers or supporting team, and champions good design practices
Documentation

Documents and reviews broader team documentation
Supports team in identifying and defining relevant documentation templates pertaining to solution delivery
Is a champion for knowledge transfer to enable/empower other team members
Functional Design

Develops functional designs for applications and integrations.
Ability to work on multiple functional areas and integrations with third party products
Keeps up to date with industry trends and vendor capabilities to produce robust functional designs
Reviews functional designs and obtains sign-offs with the cross functional business and IT teams
Provides inputs into business processes based on design capabilities
Champions sustainable, forward-looking functional designs
Testing & Test Design

Coordinates integration testing, validates test cases with stakeholders for user acceptance testing and training, and obtains sign-offs
Coordinates defects clarification, triage and coordinate resolution with engineering teams
Project Management

Manages multiple application releases and projects
Manages stakeholder expectations
Designs release scope and schedule in line with business goal, prioritization and IT capacity
System Configurations

Configures applications in line with business goals
Designs forward looking configurations by recognizing future needs aligned with the business roadmap
Develops configuration standards
Day to Day Support (Production Support)

Supports and trains junior resources and oversees quality in triage and troubleshooting practices
Leads troubleshooting efforts on critical issues with cross functional teams through resolution
Identifies improvements to address repeat issues
Training and Change Management

Works with functional leadership teams to set expectations and conduct planning and execution of SME training activities
Defines, communicates, and implements support and engagement plans
Analyzes adoption rates and issues and assesses business case realization and proposes solutions to improve

Other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION & TRAINING

Undergraduate degree in IT, Industrial Manufacturing or a related field or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
EXPERIENCE

5+ years of relevant experience
Extensive experience in Oracle Cloud Applications or Oracle ERP within SCM space
Extensive experience in a couple of Oracle Cloud SCM Modules such as OM, PO, INV, Manufacturing (Discrete), Planning, Warehouse Management, Fulfillment etc.
Must have worked in a leading consulting company or in a well-known international Company in the implementation, support of the projects, and production support
Experience on Planning (Demand Planning, MRP, MPS) is highly desired.
Worked as Sr Systems Analyst or Support Analyst for Oracle Fusion ERP application modules.
Hands-on experience in designing and configuring ERP application implementation and maintenance.
Worked in extending Oracle Fusion applications with integrations to third-party systems or homegrown systems will be preferable.
SKILLS

Have in-depth functional knowledge of Supply Chain to understand business requirements and convert them into functional and configurable solutions.
Solid understanding in Rest APIs, integrations, and familiarity with Fusion’s schema and subject areas will be highly desired.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities
Willingness to travel occasionally if needed

Pay range is $120-$150k - Final compensation will depend on experience.

Job Title: Homes.com - Senior Technical Business Analyst/ Product Owner
Job Description:
Homes.com - Senior Technical Business Analyst/ Product Owner
Job Description
Overview CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. Homes.com is already one of the fastest growing real estate portals in the industry, we are driven to be #1. Just ask Brad Bellflower, Chief Change Officer at Apartments.com. After its acquisition in 2014, Apartments.com quickly turned into the most popular place to find a place. Proven success at the highest level – and we’re doing it again with the new Homes.com. Homes.com is a CoStar Group company with 20+ years' experience in leading and growing digital marketplaces. We pride ourselves on continually improving, innovating, and setting the standard for property search and marketing experiences. With Homes.com we’re building a brand on the cusp of defining the industry. We’re looking for big thinkers, brave leaders, and creative advertising wizards ready to influence a new age of homebuying within a tried-and-true, award-winning company. Learn more about Homes.com. Our Irvine, CA team is seeking an accomplished Technical Business Analyst to join our team in supporting the supporting multiple software products and brands across the organization, such as www.homes.com and www.homesnap.com. You will have a direct impact on highly visible Homes web applications that touch millions of users. You continuously learn emerging technologies and architecture advancements and apply the learnings to improve Homes’ software products This position is located in Irvine and offers the following hybrid schedule option: 3 days onsite, 2 days remote Responsibilities Lead discovery sessions between product managers, technical managers, and user experience designers to gather requirements to build market-leading consumer web products. Serve as product ambassador internally and externally, sharing knowledge and answering questions Facilitate meetings with business stakeholders and product management to help build project charters, business processes, and business process activities. Gather business requirements and break them down into relevant, accurate, detailed, and consumable user stories that can be developed within an agile scrum framework. Write detailed Acceptance Criteria in the form of Behavior Driven Development scenarios for User Stories that can be understood by business stakeholders, software developers, and quality assurance analysts. Facilitate technical design meetings between different technical managers to help gather and document their technical solutions to the business problems for which you are defining requirements. Foster a high-level understanding of technical solutions so you can explain the solution to developers and Quality Assurance (QA) analysts. Participate in backlog refinement sessions with a scrum team to help explain and answer questions so they can accurately story point the delivery effort. Perform end-to-end User Acceptance Testing Work closely with the product manager and technical manager to help create and shape release plans. Review automation tests and quality assurance test cases to ensure they cover the relevant business scenarios. Work with product managers to help define their key performance indicators (KPI) for new initiatives. Be able to analyze and collect KPI metrics and reporting to be delivered to the product manager so they can report on the progress and success of their products and initiatives to senior management. Provide input and feedback on product roadmaps. Work with UX designers to help refine prototypes and/or high-fidelity mockups based on requirements you have gathered. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required from an accredited, not for profit university or college A track record of commitment to prior employers Minimum of 5+ years of Product, Systems, or Business analysis experience 5+ years of Product Owner experience is a plus This role is highly self-directed. Being capable of driving outcomes with very little supervision is a must. Software coding experience background is a plus. Occasionally, creating wireframes in a tool such as Visio is required for this role. Agile/Scrum experience is required Preferred Qualifications And Skills Previous project management experience is a plus Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) is a plus Understanding of relational data models and be comfortable writing basic SQL is a plus. What’s in it for You When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Virtual and in person mental health counseling services for individuals and family Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. This position offers a base salary range of $97,000-$148,000, based on relevant skills and experience and includes a generous benefits plan. #LI-Hybrid #LI-VP1
CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

Job Title: Bill n Pay Business Analyst

Job Summary: We are seeking a Bill n Pay Business Analyst with IT experience to join our team at a 3PL (third-party logistics) company. The Bill n Pay Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing the billing and payment processes for the company, using data-driven insights to improve efficiency and accuracy. The ideal candidate will have experience in business analysis, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and IT, with a strong focus on process improvement and customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities:

Analyze and optimize the billing and payment processes for the company, using data-driven insights to improve efficiency and accuracy.

Develop and maintain the company's billing and payment policies, procedures, and processes.

Monitor accounts receivable and accounts payable balances and ensure timely collection and payment of outstanding invoices.

Manage payment terms and credit limits with suppliers and customers.

Process and manage electronic payments and receipts using relevant IT systems.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop billing and payment strategies that meet those needs.

Provide support to internal stakeholders on billing and payment issues, including resolving discrepancies and errors with suppliers and customers.

Develop and implement technology solutions to streamline billing and payment processes and improve efficiency.

Ensure compliance with company and industry regulations, including financial reporting requirements.

Provide regular reports on billing and payment performance, identifying areas for improvement and cost savings.

Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and external customers to ensure customer satisfaction and timely resolution of issues.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in business administration, IT, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

5+ years of experience in business analysis, accounts receivable, accounts payable, or related fields.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Experience in IT and knowledge of billing and payment technology solutions.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Knowledge of financial reporting requirements and regulations.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's degree in business administration, IT, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

Certification in business analysis, accounting, or finance (e.g., CBAP, CPA, CMA).

Experience in the logistics or transportation industry.

Experience with billing and payment systems (e.g., Bill.com, QuickBooks).

Knowledge of Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies.

Purpose:

The Sr. BPA (Business Process Analyst) is responsible for creating detailed requirements specifications for Connected Car development including new features and enhancements such as core platform and customer channels like web portal and mobile app. This includes coordinating with business, engineering, and multiple stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and define product and system requirements, create a high-level system design, and interface specifications with the help of a Solution Architect. Evaluate business and system requirements, ensure technical # feasibility and estimate development effort and implementation sequence.

The BPA will work closely with project team members to perform the required tasks using a combination of solid business understanding, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent leadership and facilitation techniques.

Work with business stakeholders to understand/evaluate business requirements and translate them to system requirements specifications that will serve as input for development.

Work with multiple stakeholders to analyze requirements, clarify design dependencies, and support functional and non-functional requirements.

Manage and mitigate project risks and issues.

Work with a wide variety of stakeholders including partners, suppliers, customers, and organizational entities to ensure timely delivery of high quality and cost-effective solutions.

Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors.

The Research Translation Group within UCI Beall Applied Innovation manages all UCI-owned IP, including drafting and negotiating agreements (from non-disclosure agreements to exclusive licenses) and coordinating the support structure necessary for the commercial success of UCI’s research results, discoveries, and inventions. UCI Beall Applied Innovation’s (BAI) engages its collaborative teams, including the Research Translation Group (traditional technology transfer office), Industry Sponsored Research Group, Enterprise Collaboration Group, and New Ventures Group, with the responsibility of enabling industry access to UCI-developed knowledge and research results, for the public benefit and improving lives. UCI Beall Applied Innovation staff actively partners with the UCI researcher community and industry to facilitate the movement of UCI-developed knowledge and discoveries into products and services. The three top-level aims driving the objectives and activity of the UCI BAI staff members are to cultivate a Use-inspired Research Culture, incorporate Actionable Market and Business Intelligence in decision-making, ensure Cadence of Business & apply Deal-Making Expertise for business transactions.
The Senior Licensing Officer will be critical in cultivating, managing, and stewarding the commercialization of UCI’s life sciences technology and research portfolio. The life sciences portfolio includes university-developed research, discoveries, and inventions at various stages of development, from conception to commercialization. The successful incumbent will develop and manage strong relationships with faculty and industry partners. This person will apply a blend of technical, business, legal, and entrepreneurial knowledge to successfully manage UCI’s intellectual property, including developing and implementing specific marketing strategies for each technology.

Proven ability to review and evaluate inventions for patentability (including prior art and freedom to operate).

Position Overview: We seek a highly skilled and experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our finance team. As a Senior Business Analyst for Finance, you will play a pivotal role in driving financial analysis, strategic planning, and process improvement initiatives to optimize the financial performance of our organization. Your expertise will be crucial in translating complex financial data into actionable insights that inform decision-making at the executive level.

Responsibilities:

Financial Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct comprehensive financial analysis, including variance analysis, trend analysis, and forecasting, to provide insights into the company's financial performance.
Prepare and present detailed financial reports and dashboards to senior management, highlighting key performance indicators, risks, and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify trends, patterns, and potential areas for improvement in financial processes.
Strategic Planning:
Assist in the development and execution of the company's financial strategies and long-term financial plans.
Provide input and insights into budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling activities to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with senior leaders to align financial objectives with the overall business strategy.
Process Improvement:
Identify inefficiencies in financial processes and systems, proposing and implementing solutions to enhance operational effectiveness.
Streamline financial workflows, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and efficiency in financial data management and reporting.
Lead and contribute to cross-functional projects aimed at improving financial processes and optimizing resource allocation.
Data Interpretation and Insights:
Analyze complex financial data, utilizing advanced tools and techniques, to derive actionable insights and recommendations.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making.
Provide thought leadership and expert guidance on financial matters, contributing to strategic discussions and initiatives.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including finance teams, business units, and external partners, to gather requirements and understand business needs.
Act as a liaison between finance and other departments, fostering effective communication and alignment of objectives.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. A master’s degree or relevant professional certification (CFA, CPA, etc.) is a plus.
Proven experience of 5 years as a Business Analyst, Financial Analyst, or similar role, preferably in a senior capacity within a corporate finance setting.
Strong financial analysis, forecasting, budgeting, and financial modeling proficiency.
Advanced proficiency in financial software, data analysis tools, and Microsoft Excel.
Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and data interpretation skills.
Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders.
Demonstrated experience in process improvement and project management.
Strategic mindset with the ability to contribute to overall business strategy discussions.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional and dynamic environment.

Join our dynamic finance team as a Senior Business Analyst and make a significant impact on our financial decision-making processes. We offer competitive compensation, a collaborative work environment, and opportunities for professional growth and development.

As a Senior Manager of SAP Services, you will be responsible for working within the framework of a team and performing the following activities during specific timeframes:
First 30 days
Take and complete all company and department-specific SOPs and trainings.
Learn about your team structure and the individuals that make it up.
Discover and familiarize yourself with the systems we use.
Understand and follow the processes we have in place.
Join the SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products) S4/HANA (High-Performance Analytic Appliance) project team.
Assist with SAP operational and project tasks, as required.
Within 60 days
Identify gaps in processes and systems.
Recommend and implement solutions to remediate identified gaps.
Suggest process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Identify growth and training opportunities for the team.
Propose and assist with software upgrades as necessary.
Continuously engage in SAP project management tasks.
After 90 days to 1 year
Provide oversight across our SAP environment.
Address concerns to ensure the delivery of quality solutions to customers.
Maintain an active role in SAP platform governance.
Contribute to change management initiatives.
Ongoing
Manage a team of subject matter experts responsible for the SAP platform and its components.
Ensure system availability and optimal performance.
Provide technical support for the SAP system.
Identify and resolve system issues effectively.
Position Requirements:
This position requires the following skills and attributes:
More than seven years of technical management and supervisory experience in a dynamic, high-tech systems development environment, including IT Business Analyst and Systems Analyst roles in SAP systems. Equivalent education and experience will be considered.
Expert-level knowledge of SAP's core technical platform, including interface methodologies, workflow, updates process, code optimization, background processes, and innovative techniques.
Strong skills in Business Analysis and Systems Analysis, with expertise in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), particularly in comprehensive Needs Analysis, User Requirements development, and analytical thinking.
Proficient in developing process maps, visualizing as-is and to-be processes, and proposing creative solutions to business needs.
Demonstrated competency in strategic thinking, leadership, and managing multi-discipline, high-performance work teams and groups, with strong relationship management abilities.
Proven experience in strategic planning, project management, and process improvement, including the development of long-range roadmaps and successful execution of multiple large projects using project management methodologies.
Effective communication and collaboration skills, including working with matrixed and global teams, thriving in fast-paced, changing environments, and identifying and escalating issues, as needed.
Strong ability to manage competing work items effectively and delegate when appropriate.
Proactive approach to addressing challenges associated with the day-to-day operations of SAP systems.
Stays current with industry developments related to the SAP environment.
Familiarity with Service Now and SAP application monitoring solutions, such as Solution Manager or AppDynamics.
Track record of successfully developing and implementing new technology.
Timely response to information requests, including audits.

Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

Job Title: 10703 - Sr. QA Analyst – (CCS Product QA Operations)
Job Description:
10703 - Sr. QA Analyst – (CCS Product QA Operations)


Purpose:

The Sr. Quality Assurance Engineer is a self-motivated individual who is responsible for the design and development of test strategies, fixtures, and processes used to test connected car telematics platform.


Essential Functions:

Work collaboratively with Product teams to translate telematics feature specifications/requirements into high-quality, timely deliverables as a strong hands-on QA member in telematics product validation activities.
Work with multiple stakeholders to design test strategies, test plans, and test cases from requirements, design documents, and specifications for testing connected car telematics platforms.
Analyze and report the production issue and ticket trend and provide recommendation.
Estimate test case writing and execution efforts and keep track of progress.
Test case authoring and holding test case reviews with stakeholders.
Execution of test cases, including functional, smoke, regression, and integration tests.
Expected to research and analyze the product features being tested.
Expected to actively participate as a team member in the elaboration of user stories, and associated acceptance criteria.
Expected to review User Interfaces for consistency and functionality.
Responsible for the creation and execution of test plans with the goal of discovering bugs/quality issues within the software.
Responsible for recording test progress and results, as well as assist in analyzing the testing metrics to determine systemic issues, trends, categorization of escaped defects, etc.
Reporting, tracking, validating, and closing defects.
Recording test results and reporting them.
Participation in daily scrum meetings.
Participate in system design sessions to provide input on the testability of new features.
Support our processes by keeping track of and gathering metrics on all testing activities.
Participate in all phases of risk management assessments and software and hardware development, with an emphasis on the analysis of user requirements, test design, and test tool selection.
Using metrics in the quantitative project management concept to identify areas for improvement.
Providing innovative solutions for a more efficient testing strategy.
Analyze current testing tools and technology utilized and develop steps and processes to improve and expand upon them.
Production issue tracking, troubleshooting activities, ticket creation and maintenance, ticket assignments, as well as vendor follow-up.
Support testing efforts by engaging in troubleshooting and provide solutions to issues.


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


Basic Requirements:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree or equivalent in the field of business, computers, information systems or related degree.
4+ years of IT exp. or industry work experience in quality assurance or project IT experience.
4+ years of experience in a similar role preferably in the Telematics, Telecommunications, or automobile industry.
Requires a deep understanding of software QA methodologies, tools and processes.
Must possess an astute understanding of the Agile manifesto and Scrum development framework.
Will work with the team to determine product quality and release readiness standards.
Must have significant experience in the creation and management of automated test suites.
Must demonstrate the ability to work with various QA/Testing tools and technologies.
Experience with Web, Web Service/API, and Mobile software applications testing required.
Must demonstrate the ability to cross-pollinate and instill a ‘test infected’ mindset upon the development team.
Must perform generalized tasks as needed to work as a part of a cohesive team towards achieving Sprint goals.
Must have knowledge of the current trends and latest advancements in software QA.
Will work to drive innovation and streamline the overall testing process within the team and the company at large.
Will assist in the creation of company-wide guidance and policy concerning quality assurance.
Must demonstrate significant initiative, persistence and the ability to work well as part of an empowered delivery team.
Must have strong communication skills, with the ability to interact with both technical and non-technical resources.

Salary Range - $91,810 to $131,285

Oneida Technical Solutions, LLC (OTS), was founded in 2014 and quickly established itself as a reliable partner capable of providing a variety of information technology and cyber solutions across highly complex, highly regulated and highly secure environments, including the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD), healthcare, higher education, law enforcement, retail, casino gaming and more.

Our innovative cyber capabilities and programs have made us trusted partners for IT modernization projects, implementing upgrades and accelerating the delivery of new solutions for the DoD and commercial industries with consumer-driven technology.

We are currently bidding on a contract providing IT and Cyber Security services for the IT Division within the NSWC Corona Division, Corporate Operations Department, supporting the Command Information Office, Information Technology Operations, Information Management Customer Services and Cyber Security.

We are seeking an Operations Analyst II to join our team. Daily responsibilities include:

Examining and assessing the workings of an organization to identify and offer solutions to problems, and drafts procedures for improving operations.

Obtain and secure information by interviewing employees and/or customers, reading reports, analyzing operations, determining project scope, reviewing databases to determine which data are relevant and what methods should be used to analyze them; and describes and records the results and recommendations in reports.

Produces practical solutions by describing requirements, studying system or process capabilities, analyzing alternative solutions, and preparing system specifications, using statistical analysis, simulation, and optimization.


Position requirements: Must possess a minimum of a Bachelor's level degree in an Engineering discipline, Physics or Mathematics Must have a minimum of 7 years professional experience in operations research Secret Clearance required

RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.



The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.



At RH we believe deeply that the "right" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take "no" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.



The Assistant Gallery Leader provides leadership to cross-functional teams across all aspects of the business. The Assistant Leader over Gallery Curation is accountable for creating a luxury experience both internally and externally. This role is ideal for those with a sense of personal style, polished appearance, refined taste and a discerning eye for luxury.

Represent the RH brand through polished communication, personal appearance and professionalism

Work with internal partners to establish strategies that drive sales and ensure execution according to RH standards

Learn and communicate the RH design point of view and product assortment
Continuously drive results through team engagement, empowerment and accountability
Display a passion for Visual Merchandising, Inventory and, Store Operations
Support Leadership team with new initiatives and on-going training
Embrace change and deliver top results with a positive attitude no matter what the obstacle
Lead by example and ensure Gallery Associates feel supported and inspired

5+ years leadership and visual experience within luxury retail
Proven experience embracing change and delivering top results with a positive attitude no matter what the obstacle

IT Functional Architect - Oracle MFG

The IT Systems Functional Architect role serves as the primary IT liaison with Niagara business users; plans and coordinates the implementation and deployment of new software applications as well as the enhancement and maintenance of existing applications. The IT Systems Functional Architect is primarily responsible for providing timely application support to business users and ensures that application issues are efficiently and effectively resolved. The IT Systems Functional Architect is responsible for project plan development, project execution management, project status monitoring and reporting to project sponsors and steering committee. More specifically, the IT Systems Functional Architect is responsible for gathering business and functional requirements, and for coordinating with application vendors and/or internal development (technical) teams to ensure that the solution design, build and testing approach satisfies/meets requirements. The ideal candidate is able to be a hands-on individual performer in addition to providing leadership to a functional team comprised of 2 – 4 functional Analysts.

Essential Functions

Design, build, and implement functional and technical solutions which meet desired business, functional and non-functional requirements
Lead and actively participate in all phases of system implementation including requirements gathering, functional and technical design, system design and development, testing and roll-out and support.
Provide Functional & Testing experience in the areas of Supply Chain, Distributions, Manufacturing or Finance.
Assesses project impact of system changes on users and internal and external customers and stakeholders.
Controls scope and requirement gathering and design sessions.
Identify risks and benefits of alternate designs; calculates costs/benefits of potential actions or solutions to establish their viability/ROI.
Leads team in configuration and testing tasks - Regression testing experience on Applications Functional and Integration testing requirements.
Utilize disciplined custom software development methodology or COTS package implementation process for continuous evolution and optimization of applications/business solutions.
Responsible for issue, problem and change management functions to ensure application availability, uptime and service levels to business users.
Ability to identify and address root cause of production problems, and a strong background in resolving application support issues.
Ability to formulate and document requirements, design specifications, and test plans for extensions to Supply Chain, Distributions, Manufacturing or Finance applications which include, reports, interfaces, conversions, and enhancements.
Develop, generate and deliver steering committee meeting presentations to communicate project status, seek guidance and drive decisions.
Follow industry standards related to software development lifecycle (SDLC) and software quality assurance (SQA) practices and methodologies to ensure quality of project deliverables and technical solutions.
Enforce and manage project deadlines and schedules.
Commit to quality deliverables while ensuring technical solutions are on-scope, on-time and on-budget.
Accurately prepare written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, professional, and engaging.
Follow through with commitments and assume additional responsibilities without being asked
Provide weekly status reports.
Partner with internal, external and business partners to support the Niagara business application.
Open and manage SR service request tickets with vendor level 3 support.
Facilitate communication/relationship within Niagara business and IT.

25% - on average travels 1 week out of the month

Technical Business Analyst
Job Description
Overview CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. LoopNet, the most popular place to find a space, is the #1 global commercial real estate marketplace. With more than 12 million global unique monthly visitors, LoopNet provides brokers, buyers and sellers with what they need to meet and make deals. LoopNet has established itself as the most effective and far-reaching digital marketplace for commercial real estate owners and brokers. We are not done yet! We continue to focus on driving expansion by increasing market share in the US and abroad, continuously innovating and enhancing the product and growing a powerhouse global team to reach our goals. Learn more about LoopNet. Our Irvine, CA team is seeking an accomplished Technical Business Analyst to join our team in supporting the supporting multiple software products and brands across the organization. You will have a direct impact on highly visible web applications that touch millions of users. You continuously learn emerging technologies and architecture advancements and apply the learnings to improve software products This position is located in Irvine and offers the following hybrid schedule option: 3 days onsite, 2 days remote Responsibilities Lead discovery sessions between product managers, technical managers, and user experience designers to gather requirements to build market-leading consumer web products. Serve as product ambassador internally and externally, sharing knowledge and answering questions Facilitate meetings with business stakeholders and product management to help build project charters, business processes, and business process activities. Gather business requirements and break them down into relevant, accurate, detailed, and consumable user stories that can be developed within an agile scrum framework. Write detailed Acceptance Criteria in the form of Behavior Driven Development scenarios for User Stories that can be understood by business stakeholders, software developers, and quality assurance analysts. Facilitate technical design meetings between different technical managers to help gather and document their technical solutions to the business problems for which you are defining requirements. Foster a high-level understanding of technical solutions so you can explain the solution to developers and Quality Assurance (QA) analysts. Participate in backlog refinement sessions with a scrum team to help explain and answer questions so they can accurately story point the delivery effort. Perform end-to-end User Acceptance Testing Work closely with the product manager and technical manager to help create and shape release plans. Review automation tests and quality assurance test cases to ensure they cover the relevant business scenarios. Work with product managers to help define their key performance indicators (KPI) for new initiatives. Be able to analyze and collect KPI metrics and reporting to be delivered to the product manager so they can report on the progress and success of their products and initiatives to senior management. Provide input and feedback on product roadmaps. Work with UX designers to help refine prototypes and/or high-fidelity mockups based on requirements you have gathered. Basic Qualifications Minimum of 5+ years of Product, Systems, or Business analysis experience 2+ years of Product Owner experience is a plus Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, MIS, computer science, or other related technical field. This role is highly self-directed. Being capable of driving outcomes with very little supervision is a must. Software coding experience background is a plus. Occasionally, creating wireframes in a tool such as Visio is required for this role. Agile/Scrum experience is required Bachelor’s Degree required from an accredited, not for profit university or college A track record of commitment to prior employers Preferred Qualifications And Skills Previous project management experience is a plus Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) is a plus Understanding of relational data models and be comfortable writing basic SQL is a plus. What’s in it for You When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Virtual and in person mental health counseling services for individuals and family Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. This position offers a base salary range of $67,400.00 – 117,900.00, based on relevant skills and experience and includes a generous benefits plan. LI-Hybrid LI-MH1

Overview:
The QSC Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler holds a crucial leadership role in global and plant-level operations, contributing significantly to overall planning, scheduling, purchasing, execution, inventory management, and ERP planning systems processes. As a Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler at QSC, responsibilities include creating and managing the Master Production Schedule and Rough Cut Capacity Planning for both internal and external manufacturing sites. The primary objective is to optimize production, considering customer and forecast demand, production capacities, material availability, and resource requirements. Addressing production issues, risks, and proposing effective solutions is a key aspect of the role.

This position involves managing the timely creation and release of production work orders, ensuring material availability to support daily, weekly, and monthly production schedules for in-house manufacturing. Utilizing ORACLE ERP and E2Open advance planning systems, the Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler analyzes production plans, material requirements, and material availability to support production activity and execution processes. Collaboration with engineering, purchasing, and production is essential to facilitate changes, ensuring appropriate configuration and communication of material requirements. Additionally, the role includes working with production leads on scheduling, capacity requirements planning, and providing input to management regarding delays in materials deliveries and/or production schedules.

Beyond planning and scheduling responsibilities, the Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler contributes to managing, controlling, and reporting companywide inventories and related activities. This involves interacting with various functions such as product managers, warehousing and logistics, sales, sales operations, tactical and strategic purchasing, and finance. The role extends to performing advanced business analytics and analysis to derive actionable insights and recommendations related to production planning and inventory management. The Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler collaborates closely with the management team, strategic purchasing, and internal customers to identify and implement strategic objectives for improving planning, scheduling, and inventory performance. The role also includes handling special analytical projects and assisting in the implementation or development of systems, tools, applications, and processes for moderately complex data capture and business analysis. With above-average knowledge of APICS and MRP planning systems, the Senior Supply Planner/Master Scheduler plays a crucial role in aligning and optimizing ORACLE ERP and E2PR advance planning systems across all business areas. This encompasses master data management and ERP planning system setup to enhance accuracy, efficiency, and predictability in production planning, materials requirements planning, and inventory control. The work involves a balance of independent and collaborative efforts.

Base Pay Range 82,000 - 118,000

The above reflects the pay range that QSC reasonably expects to pay for this role. This pay range also depends on various factors such as job duties and requirements, relevant experience and skills and geographic location. In addition to the base salary range, QSC offers a comprehensive package including but not limited to health benefits, 401K or Roth retirement plans, generous time off and profit sharing.

QSC thrives where innovative technology and compelling audio-visual experiences intersect. For over 50 years, QSC has pioneered the technology and solutions that enable immersive cinema, live performance audio, themed entertainment, digital collaboration and meeting experiences for our customers and partners around the world. A globally recognized innovator in the design, engineering, and manufacture of category leading high-performance loudspeakers, digital mixers, power amplifiers, audio processors, digital cinema solutions, and the Q-SYS™ software-based audio, video and control Ecosystem.

By joining the QSC team, you will be in a challenging, collaborative, fun, and innovative environment. We encourage employees to take ownership, to color outside the lines, and to imagine possibilities. Our culture is casual but dynamic, with cross-functional teams collaborating on creating memorable audio-visual experiences that deliver joy to people, wherever they are. At QSC, fun and hard work go hand in hand. Join us and make a difference in the way people experience movies, meetings, presentations, live performances, and much more.

Q-SYS is a cloud-manageable audio, video and control (AV&C) Platform built around a modern, standards-based IT architecture. With established solutions across Corporate, Education, Hospitality, Venues & Events, Cinema, Government, Healthcare, and Transportation, Q-SYS redefines what is possible for live and virtual experiences by uniting hardware and software partners, developers, and creators.

QSC Pro Audio delivers high-performance loudspeakers, digital mixers, power amplifiers, software and accessories. Our innovative products and solutions, supported with free training & education and unparalleled customer service, set the stage for creators, performers, and entertainment providers to confidently deliver impactful experiences for their audiences.

rack and report material shortages, addressing discrepancies; may prepare reports as requested.

Manage personal time and resources efficiently to complete assigned projects accurately and on time.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)
Work together with Automation, Cloud Security Posture Management and ITS Global Operations teams on the implementation, automation, and maintenance of new Cloud security monitoring policies within our cloud environment
Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process
Coordinate with platform Information System Security Officer with the daily management of information security related queries and requests

Experience with Microsoft Azure is preferable: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Policies, Azure Application Gateways, Web Application Firewalls, Network Security Groups, among others
Network infrastructure knowledge on TCP/IP and Internet protocols
Experience with Palo Alto Prisma is preferable
CISSP, CISM, CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional) or CCSK (Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge) certifications or equivalent experience is preferred
